name: BPG Explores Tyntesfield
description:
Image source: National Trust website


Tyntesfield is a beautiful Victorian country house by great scenery in North Somerset that has been gradually restored to it's former glory.

"...created by one of England’s richest commoners, William Gibbs...Gothic look, mysterious, fairytale mansion. Terraced lawns give way to spacious parkland filled with hundreds of trees collected by the family, and a glorious
walled kitchen garden beyond."
National Trust website

Entrance Price:
(Normal Price: £14.05) / FREE for NT Members!

To join the National Trust click here
(Please note this affiliate link helps support the group)

Click here for Tyntesfield Price Info

Suggested Equipment:
Tripod
Suitable walking shoes

For further details: Tyntesfield info

name: Newark Park
description:
Image source:National Trust website


Newark Park is a Tudor hunting lodge with gorgeous views of the countryside surrounding the estate.

"Newark Park stands proud on top of the Cotswold escarpment, looking down into the Ozleworth valley and to the Mendips beyond. The Newark estate is situated in an unspoilt corner of Gloucestershire . . . founded by an influential English courtier to Henry VIII in 1550 . . .Newark has an intriguing story to tell, with a quirky collection of furnishings and impressive views. A place of architectural intrigue, quaint gardens and sprawling parkland there is much to see and do at Newark."
National Trust website

Entrance Price:
(Normal Price: £9.00) / FREE for NT Members!

To join the National Trust click here
(Please note this affiliate link helps support the group)

Click here for Newark Park Price Info

Travelling time: From Bristol it is approximately 50 minutes drive

If you are able to offer a lift or need a lift please contact me directly here

Suggested Equipment:

Suitable walking shoes
Warm clothing (dependant on conditions)
Tripod

For further details: Newark park info

name: CHALLENGE | CLIFTON (black & white)

venue.name: White Lion Bar (next to Avon Gorge Hotel)

description:
First challenge of the new year ... and we are going back to black & white!

The aim of this challenge will be to produce 5 black and white images based on the topics. The topics themselves will be structured to make the most of the black and white theme. We'll also be including a worksheet which we hope will help.

There are a couple ways to produce black and white images : the simplest way can be to convert in post-production. There are many programmes and apps out there that can do this for you - and it may be that your camera has a built-in black and white editing filter already, which you can use after taking the shot. There will be full details on how to do this in your manual. 

Another way is to set up "in camera", so you set your camera to shoot in black and white. If you are not sure how to do this, either check your manual or speak to one of us before the challenge starts, so we can help show you the settings - please bring your manual, in case we need to check it! If you can't find your manual, check online for a free download version. There are many guides to setting up cameras available, a quick Google search is sure to help.

If you feel you want to do a bit of background reading about black and white photography, there are some great blogs out there. 

We think it will be fun to try something different, but it's not a necessity. Just come along to the Challenge and leave your shots as they are. 

As for the challenge, as usual :


5 topics / 2 hours.  You can use any camera you like - mobile phone, iPad, DSLR, film, compact. The challenge is to capture something as interesting and unique as possible.  That could be, for example, an alternative angle, a different perspective or viewpoint, a close up, vibrant colour or unusual detail. Be creative.

1.  Themes will be given out on the day by your event hosts at 11am and posted on the meetup site at this time

2.  You have up to 2 hours to photograph the themes, shooting as many different versions and options as you like

3.  Upload 5 final images : 1 for each theme only - feel free to put the rest on our Flickr site so everyone can see more of your work

4.  Take time to look and comment on other members' images - and let them know what you like about their shot(s)

name: Wildlife Photographer of the Year 2016
description:
In case you missed the opportunity to attend the Wildlife Exhibition event in November I'm running it again.


The exhibition is running until 5th March 2017.

Venue: M-Shed

Opening Times
Tuesday-Friday: 10am-5pm
Saturday and Sunday: 10am-6pm

Entry:
£5 - Adult
£3 - Concessions
Children under 16 – Free


For more info about the exhibition - click here

Please note: You are not be allowed to take photos inside the exhibtfion.

Re: Uploading photos - Please can you upload a maximum of 4 of your favourite photos, if you have more please put them on Flickr, there is limited space on Meetup
how_to_find_us: Meet inside M-Shed in the foyer

name: Discovering Wildlife in Bristol talk
description:
https://i1.wp.com/www.biosphereonline.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/%C2%A9-Sam-Hobson_Wildlife-Photographer-of-the-Year.jpg?zoom=3&resize=1140%2C761

Image source: samhobson.co.uk

This event is not being run by me but thought people might be interested in this event. The information below is from the bristolmusems website.
PLEASE NOTE: You need to book in advance - click link below.

Wildlife photographer Sam Hobson will talk about his experiences of finding and photographing Bristol’s urban wildlife and offer tips on how to discover nature in your own neighbourhood.

Sam Hobson is a wildlife and conservation photographer, best known for his work with urban wildlife.

He is published regularly in international magazines, books and newspapers and his pictures have been awarded in many competitions, including the prestigious Wildlife Photographer of the Year.

He specialises in storytelling imagery – shooting photojournalistic conservation stories and crafting stand-alone images that connect the subject with its environment.

Preferring to use short lenses when possible, he combines fieldcraft and technical knowledge with creative lighting to get as close to his subjects as possible, often using remote triggers and camera traps.

For further info: www.bristolmuseums.org.uk/m-shed/whats-on/discovering-wildlife-in-bristol


Ticket prices:
Adult: £10.00
Concession: £8.00
You need to book in advance (go to the above link)

Re: Uploading photos - Please can you upload a maximum of 4 of your favourite photos, if you have more please put them on Flickr, there is limited space on Meetup

name: Leigh Woods Ramble
description:
Image source: National Trust website

Leigh Woods Ramble

Leigh Woods is a great place to go walking any time of the year, but a winter walk is always good. There are many interesting things to see. there is an old hill fort with in the woods & a 200 year old wall. You can get some glorious views of the Avon Gorge as well.

After the walk I am thinking we could go find some tea and cake in the warmth of a nice place in Clifton. Location of tea & cake is White Lion with it's views of The Clifton Suspension Bridge.

Please can you message me directly to tell me if you need a lift to Leigh Woods.
It is possible to cycle to from Clifton if you cycle across the Clifton Suspension bridge.

This location is owned by the National Trust & Forestry Commission.
Join National Trust here (Please note this affiliate link helps support the group)

Parking location:

Suggested Equipment:-


Walking Boots/Warm Clothing (as it's likely to be cold)
Tripod


Re: Uploading photos - Please can you upload a maximum of 4 of your favourite photos, if you have more please put them on Flickr, there is limited space on Meetup
